action.action-desc: Mr. Horsford (for himself and Ms. Lee of Nevada) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to establish a tax credit for installation of regionally significant electric power transmission lines.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Grid Resiliency Tax Credit Act.

paragraph.text: A robust electric power transmission system is critical to the economic, energy, and national security of the United States.
The electric grid faces challenges from aging infrastructure and a need for increased electric power transmission capacity.
The United States faces a pressing need to expand electric power transmission.

subparagraph.text: improve resilience by enabling access to diverse generation resources across the country;
promote economic benefits and create new jobs in communities across the country; and

section.header: Establishment of electric power transmission lines

subsection.text: Subpart E of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by inserting after section 48E the following new section:

section.header: Qualifying electric power transmission line credit

subsection.text: For purposes of section 46, the qualifying electric power transmission line credit for any taxable year is an amount equal to 30 percent of the qualified investment for such taxable year with respect to any qualifying electric power transmission line property of the taxpayer.

paragraph.text: For purposes of subsection (a), the qualified investment for any taxable year is the basis of any qualifying electric power transmission line property placed in service by the taxpayer during such taxable year.

paragraph.header: Certain qualified progress expenditures rules made applicable
paragraph.text: Rules similar to the rules of subsections (c)(4) and (d) of section 46 (as in effect on the day before the enactment of the Revenue Reconciliation Act of 1990) shall apply for purposes of this section.

subsection.header: Qualifying electric power transmission line property
subsection.text: For purposes of this section, the term qualifying electric power transmission line property means any overheard, submarine, or underground property—

paragraph.text: which is a qualifying electric power transmission line that transmits electricity—

subparagraph.text: across not less than 2 States or not less than 150 continuous miles, or
across the Outer Continental Shelf (as defined in section 2 of the Outer Continental Lands Act (43 U.S.C. 1331)), or

paragraph.text: The term qualifying electric power transmission line means any of the following:

clause.text: Any electric power transmission line which is—

subclause.text: originally placed in service after the date of enactment of this section,
primarily used for one or more purposes described in clause (ii), and

clause.text: The purposes described in this clause are—

subclause.text: enhancing resilience to prepare for, withstand, and recover rapidly from disruptions from the impact of weather events, wildfires, or natural disasters,
facilitating the interconnection of electric generation capacity to the bulk-power system (as defined in section 215 of the Federal Power Act), or
addressing high load needs of 2,000 ampere and above.

clause.header: Multiple transmission lines located in the same right-of-way
clause.text: A transmission line is described in this clause if such a transmission line—

subclause.text: is co-located in the same right-of-way or adjacent right-of-way as one or more other overhead, submarine, or underground transmission lines, and
together with the other transmission lines described in subclause (I), has a transmission capacity of not less than 1,000 megawatts.

clause.header: Additional requirements for new transmission property
clause.text: An electric power transmission line is described in this clause if—

item.text: includes an advanced transmission conductor, and
is capable of transmitting electricity at a voltage of not less than 100 kilovolts, or

subitem.text: capable of transmitting electricity at a voltage of not less than 345 kilovolts, or

item.text: has a transmission capacity of not less than 750 megawatts or is a transmission line described in clause (iii).

subparagraph.text: Any electric power transmission line which—

clause.text: was placed in service before the date of the enactment of this section,
is modified after the date of the enactment of this Act in a manner that increases the transmission capacity of such transmission line by not less than 500 megawatts, and
after the completion of such modification, is an electric power transmission line which satisfies the requirements under subclauses (II) and (III) of subparagraph (A)(i).

paragraph.text: The term advanced transmission conductor means a transmission conductor technology that uses recently developed technology or materials such as a composite core and such other future advances as determined by the Secretary, in consultation with the Secretary of Energy.
The term superconducting transmission line means a transmission line that conducts all of its current over a super-conducting material.
The term related transmission property means any of the following:

subparagraph.header: Transmission property used for interconnection or generator tie-line
subparagraph.text: Any electric power transmission line which is—

clause.text: placed in service after the date of enactment of this section,

subclause.text: as a generator interconnection tie line at an associated facility that extends from the secondary (high) side of a generator step-up transformer to the point of interconnection with the host transmission owner from interconnecting new generation resources or facilities to the electric grid, or
for network upgrades associated with the interconnection of new generation resources or facilities to the electric grid,

clause.text: primarily used for one or more purposes described in subparagraph (d)(1)(A)(ii), and
capable of transmitting electricity at a voltage of not less than 230 kilovolts.

subparagraph.text: Any grid enhancing technology property used in the operation of the electric power transmission line described in subparagraph (A) or (B) of subsection (d)(1).

Any conductors or cables, towers, insulators, reactors, capacitors, circuit breakers, static VAR compensators, static synchronous compensators, power converters, transformers, synchronous condensers, braking resistors, and any ancillary facilities and equipment necessary for the proper operation of the electric transmission line described in subparagraph (A) or (B) of subsection (d)(1) or for the proper operation of any property described in subsection (1)(A).

paragraph.text: The term grid enhancing technology property means power flow controls and transmission switching equipment, storage technology, and hardware or software that enables dynamic line ratings, advanced line rating management technologies, on new or existing transmission property for the purpose of enhancing the capacity, efficiency, resiliency, or reliability of an electric power transmission system and such other similar property determined by the Secretary, in consultation with the Secretary of Energy.

subsection.text: This section shall not apply to any property the construction of which begins after December 31, 2033.
Paragraph (2) of section 50(d) of the Internal Revenue Code is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking (as defined in section 48(c)(6)) and inserting (as defined in section 48(c)(6), except that subparagraph (D) of such section shall not apply) or any qualifying electric power transmission line property (as defined by section 48F(c)), and

subparagraph.text: by inserting or qualifying electric transmission line property after each energy storage technology, and
by inserting or the qualifying electric transmission line property after the energy storage technology.

subsection.text: Section 6418(f)(1)(A) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding the following new clause:

clause.text: The qualifying electric power transmission line credit under section 48F.

paragraph.text: Section 46 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking and at the end of paragraph (6),
by striking the period at the end of paragraph (7) and inserting , and, and
by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: the qualifying electric power transmission line credit.
Section 49(a)(1)(C) of such Code is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking and at the end of clause (vii),
by striking the period at the end of clause (viii) and inserting , and, and
by adding at the end the following new clause:

clause.text: the basis of any qualifying electric power transmission line property under section 48F.

paragraph.text: The table of sections for subpart E of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of such Code is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 48E the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 48F. Qualifying electric power transmission line credit.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2023.
